intro: Ephemerantha maculosa, commonly known as the spotted ephemeron, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features delicate, white flowers with a distinctive purple or red spot on the petals, which helps in attracting pollinators. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ephemerantha maculosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in marshy or riparian habitats.
